sn3.17:4.3: Seated to one side, King Pasenadi said to the Buddha:
sn3.17:4.4: “Master Gotama, is there one thing that secures benefits for both
sn3.17:4.5: the present life and lives to come?”
sn3.17:7.1: “Diligence, Great King, is one thing that, when developed and cultivated, secures benefits for both
sn3.17:7.2: the present life and lives to come.
sn3.17:7.3: The footprints of all creatures that walk can fit inside an elephant’s footprint. So an elephant’s footprint is said to be the biggest of them all.
sn3.17:7.5: In the same way, diligence is one thing that secures benefits for both
sn3.17:7.6: the present life and lives to come.”
sn3.17:7.7: This is what the Buddha said. …
sn3.17:8.1: “For one who desires a continuous flow
sn3.17:8.4: heaven, and birth in an eminent family—
